ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 129
ygData.msgSnippet: If the hinge is part of the formula, its going to be expensive to just randomly try things to see if they work.  That hinge is 13 plat a pop. OUCH!! Last time
ygData.messageBody:
If the hinge is part of the formula, its going to be expensive to just
randomly try things to see if they work. That hinge is 13 plat a pop.
OUCH!!

Last time Verant introduced new additions to a trade was the big revamp of
tailoring, and to facilitate that they added a new book that dropped from
an orc in lesser faydark.

I wouldn't be surprised if the new recipie was similar to that, and it was
a drop from some monster.

Rotgut

>Message: 1
> Date: Thu, 28 Oct 1999 08:41:55 -0400
> From: "Drake, Robert, CTR, SAM-OPAA" <Robert.Drake@...>
>Subject: RE: Gnomestock
>
>Gnomestock99 was a success! At least I had a blast. Thanks to Rotgut for
>putting it togeather and also to the other brother and sister gnomes of Sol
>Ro for bringing the kegs! It was a nice way to celebrate the knowledge of
>the 3rd Tinkering Book. We had cliff jumping, a drunken race, a party at
>King Akanon's in which he actually killed himself for some reason, a
>levitate party and many brawls. Some of us turned in our books to the POD.
>I think I saw 3 GMs there, 2 of which were fellow gnomes. A great time of
>general Gnomeing about. And I kicked a couple butts, including Ubershadows!
>=) But I died many horrible deaths, too. I look forward to the next
>Gnomestock!
>
>Kilkin Cobblepot - 28th Gemchopper - Fen Ro
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Tony Buser [mailto:gr0k@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, October 27, 1999 9:30 PM
> To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
> Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Gnomestock
>
> From: "Tony Buser" <gr0k@...>
>
> Well I had fun. heh but I didn't see any fireworks display!
>:( Well maybe
> there was a display, but I blinked and missed it. :)
>
> At the next one we should all get levitate and go to the top
>of the
> windmills! :) I did that once before, it was pretty fun.
>Would be quite a
> sight to see 40 gnomes all crowded on the roofs of the
>windmills. heh you
> can see pictures of me on the roofs at
>http://www.juju.org/photos/everquest/
>
> Also next time we should try and get the news sites like
>stratics to post a
> message on the news page about it so we can get even more
>people to come.
> Though I've never seen that many people in the akanon zone
>at one time. heh
>
> - the ORIGINAL Ubershadow Leprechaun - Gnome Rogue -
>Erollisi Marr (ignore
> that guy that stole my name on Solusek Ro grr)
>
> ---
> gr0k - Stranger in a Strange Land - http://www.juju.org
> "Linux... find out what you've been missing while
> you've been rebooting Windows NT" - Infoworld
>
> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor
>----------------------------
>
> Accurate impartial advice on everything from laptops to
>table saws.

>Here</a>

>Message: 2
> Date: Thu, 28 Oct 1999 09:21:35 -0400
> From: Paul McClung <p.e.mcclung@...>
>Subject: Re: Digest Number 128
>
>Gnomestock was fun, but I have to apologize for not being online early
>enough to make some fireworks and fishing poles for everyone, as I was
>delayed at work, and then when I got home, my cable company decided it was
>time for them to start fiddeling about in the cable box, this caused my
>cable modem to go dead. But I still managed to get online about 7:05. =)
>
>For advertising gnomestock, I sent emails to EQvault, EQstratics,
>Crossroads of Norrath, the Official Everquest site, Gnomads tinkering
>realm, the Casters Realm, Graffes Wizard realm and I think EQhaven. The
>email was sent out 4 days before the event, which was a sunday, Luke posted
>the news on Wed, the day of the event.
>
>Luke you slacker. hee hee =) Everyone was asking about you...
>
>Of those, only EQvault and Crossroads of Norrath posted the email, to be
>honest, I was a bit disappointed in the other sites for not helping us out.
> =(
>
>At anyrate, I think Gnomestock was a success, there were gnomes everywhere,
>in fact, I think it was the most crouded Ak'anon had been in a long long
time.
>
>Some screenshots I took are at this address:
>
>http://www.lockjaw.hamptoncity.com/gnomestock.html
>
>Rotgut
>
>
>

____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____

>Message: 5
> Date: 28 Oct 1999 15:12:19 -0000
> From: jordanis@...
>Subject: Tinkering book and reciepies
>
>Ok need some help..
>
>1) I know books one and two have locations in Steamfont at the windmills
(common knowledge)
>but where is book 3? and is there a book 4?
>
>I have all the recipies for book 3 but want the actual books so when
changes are made i can find
>them quickly.
>
>2) UNDERWATER BREATHING.. well according to the patch we have this now..
>
>I'm not sure which book yet as i can't get ingame. but i'll check books
one and two however
>something tells me that it's not going to be in those.. anyone HAVE 3 and
can check there
>and post it perhaps.. or give location of book 3?
>
>3) PETITION/FEEDBACK/BUG the fireworks.. yes as you all know they are
bad.. but it LOOKS like
>the same bug that FLARE had a while ago.. so i think it's FIXABLE.. seen
some posts that
>said a guide saw it and laughed well all i can say is i think he didn't
know he was looking
>at a BUG.. that is NOT supposed to do that.. Flare had the same problem
after thier 2nd major
>patch.. took em 6 weeks to fix. but it's working now.. so i think it can
be patched rather easily
>if they know the cause.
>
>4) Are there more books out there?? new recipies to find, etc... so far I
see perhaps 2 items of any USE
>in this trade.. Cams, and possibly the lockpicks. The rest are for FUN
and not really needed in the
>game yet.. (possibly the Stalking probes could be usefull if the duration
was not 5 seconds :(
>
>
>Meraxes Glibilskym, Fennin Ro
>Gnomish Magician and Tinkerer
>
>
>

>___________________________________________________________________________

>Message: 7
> Date: Thu, 28 Oct 1999 09:28:04 PDT
> From: "Dave Duncan" <deduncan19@...>
>Subject: What's going to happen.
>
>Ok...
>
>
>So we all know that "according to the patch" Kedge has been itemized and
>underwater breathing apparatus' have been introduced. Many people are going
>to be begging us for these items, and they will be willing to pay top
>dollar. HOPEFULLY Verant has included the recipe for the underwater
>breathing aparatus somewhere that is somewhat easy to locate. A possible
>solution is kedge keep itself. It makes sense... No recipe until now...new
>items there...maybe something drops it. Just a thought, not spreading any
>rumors just wanna get ideas floating. I haven't been on since the patch as
>I am currently at work, but if any of you have any ideas, post 'em.
>
>Litre Hosen
>31st Gnome Necro, Solusek Ro
>
>

>Message: 18
> Date: 29 Oct 1999 03:27:29 -0000
> From: sragan@...
>Subject: New Tinkerable item, scuba gear ?
>
>
>Hello folks,
>
>Well, it looks like Verant actually threw us a bone this time, with the
new patch, apparently there is a new tinkerable item that we have. I have
heard that it is some kind of water breathing item.
>
>There is also a new component at the windmills in Steamfont, a 'hinge' or
something I forget what it was called.
>
>Of course the recipe is a mystery at the moment, (Lets all say it
together... "Verant Bastards!" ) I talked to all the npc's in steamfont
and no new quests, the water breathing thing is NOT mentioned in any of the
tinkering books that we have a present.
>
>So, just as we figure out the fishing pole mystery, we have a new one in
trying to find out the recipe of the 'scuba gear'.
>
>Didn't have too much time to do much searching tonight, but keep your ears
open for rumors about another book with more recipes or the recipe for the
'scuba gear'.
>
>Cheers,
>
>"FizzWizz" of tunare
>
>

____
>___________________________________________________________________________
____

>Message: 19
> Date: Thu, 28 Oct 1999 20:33:27 -0700
> From: "Kevin Hartman" <Kevin_Hartman@...>
>Subject: New Patch
>
>Anybody notice the very last line of the new patch?
>
>*Trade Skill Enhancements*
>
>Enhancements have been made to the Tinkering trade skill to facilitate
>underwater breathing.
>
>I haven't had a chance to look, but I'm going to be checking my tinkering
>books to see if this new recipe magically appeared. It's probably in Journal
>IX, which would suck because we would have to get hold of that Cazic Thule
>guy and have him cough it up.
>
>Not sure what the stats are, but if this allows one to actually have
>underwater breathing, we could make a fortune. Especially since they just
>itemized Kedge as well. Just hang out in Dagnor's Cauldron with your
>supplies and bug the people heading in to Kedge.
>
> Washoo
> Enchantress of Karana
>
>
>
>
>

>Message: 20
> Date: Thu, 28 Oct 1999 20:50:44 PDT
> From: "D. F." <led_orc@...>
>Subject: Re: New Patch
>
>Hello all,
>Long time listener, first time caller :)
>
>Any way, about the formula for the scuba gear, I frankly have no idea.
>However, I can verify that there is no new information in the tinkering
>books. I went back to Ak'anon and bought both of them again, and nada.
>Also, I looked around Ak'anon and was able to find any new quests. Being a
>rogue, however, I wasn't able to really check the caster quests, so
>something might be there.
>
>I do have an idea though. Since this came in the same patch as Kedge Keep,
>the formula might be in or around there, like the Cauldron. Not much, but
>all I can think of.
>
>Good hunting,
>
>Xisten, gnome rogue of the 18th mask
>
>
